verses.verse: ((1 This Psalm was made after the return of the people from Babylon, and showeth that the means of their deliverance was wonderful after the seventy years of captivity forspoken by Jeremiah, in 300 25:12 and 29:10.) ) When the Lord brought again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

Then was our mouth (He showeth how the godly ought to rejoice when God gathereth his Church or delivereth it.) filled with laughter, and our tongue with joy: then said they among the (If the infidels confess God’s wonderful work, the faithful can never show themselves sufficiently thankful.) heathen, The Lord hath done great things for them.
The Lord hath done great things for us, whereof we rejoice.
O Lord, bring again our captivity, as the (It is no more impossible to God to deliver his people, than to cause the rivers to run in the wilderness and barren places.) rivers in the South.
They that sow in tears, shall reap in joy.

They went weeping, and carried (That is, seed which was scarce and dear: meaning, that they which trusted in God’s promise to return, had their desire.) precious seed: but they shall return with joy, and bring their sheaves.
